content.description:
Start on the same holds as

Homer

, but climb directly up the arete instead of following the jugs out left to the original

Homer

finish. It has unique climbing for the grade, is tall enough, and climbs a prominent feature.
content.location:
Start the same as

Homer

, and go straight up the arete.

content.description:
This starts to the right of

Homer

on the lowest right side of the overhang. Traverse left on jugs along the seam/lip of the overhang until youâ€™re into the jugs on

Homer

, then climb jugs and more jugs into the finish of the other lines.

This is a great warm-up with a ton of moves.
content.location:
Start to the right of

Homer

on good holds at the base of the overhang. The entire traverse follows a continuous seam of jugs in the rock which wraps around the boulder.

content.description:
The Odyssey is the center line on the bloc. Start on a left hand jug and large, right hand edge. Climb straight up on incredible rock until traversing left at the jug rail and topping out on great edges.

This one is hard to beat at the grade.
content.location:
This is less than 1 minute down and left from

Calypso

and the Stumpy roof. The climbs face downhill towards the valley.

content.description:
This is the left line on the bloc and is also well worth doing. Start on the rounded arete, and climb on incuts up and right until reaching the topout traverse of

The Odyssey

.
content.location:
It is located to the left of

The Odyssey

on the rounded arete next to a tree.

content.description:
This is the right line on the bloc. Start on good holds on the small overhang to the right of

The Odyssey

. Climb up and left, traversing the entire face into the topout jugs.
content.location: It is the right line on The Odyssey Bloc.
